ai.summary: Crofters Woods Walk is a short, family-friendly 2.8 km woodland trail in the UK. It follows flat to gently undulating paths through shaded trees, making it suitable for all ages and abilities.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat to gently undulating woodland paths, with compact dirt and gravel surfaces. Expect exposed roots in places, some bark chips, and occasional damp patches. The route is well shaded and easy to follow.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy, comfortable footwear and bring a lightweight waterproof layer. Stick to marked paths and keep children and pets under control. Be prepared for uneven surfaces, mud, and occasional puddles after rain. In woodland areas watch for low branches and roots; mobile signal can be weak in valleys. Check the weather before you go and bring a small first aid kit and water. Tick awareness is advised during warmer months; perform a quick check after returning home.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March–October); walkable year-round with appropriate footwear and conditions.
